de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.scenario
Class DefaultHostBuilder

java.lang.Object
  de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.scenario.DefaultHostBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
Builder, Composable, Configurable, HostBuilder
public class DefaultHostBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements HostBuilder, Composable, Builder

This builder will parse an XML subtree and create hosts as specified there. It expects a tree which looks as follows: <HostBuilder> <Host groupID="...">... <Group size="..." groupID="...">... <HostBuilder/> The exact values for XML tags are specified as constants in this class (see below).

Version:
3.0, 29.11.2007
Author:
Konstantin Pussep, Sebastian Kaune

Field Summary
static java.lang.String GROUP_ID_TAG
          XML attribute with this name specifies the id of the group, which is used to refer to this group lateron, e.g. when you specify scenario actions.
static java.lang.String GROUP_SIZE_TAG
          XML attribute with this name specifies the size of the group.
static java.lang.String GROUP_TAG
          XML element with this name specifies a group of hosts.
static java.lang.String HOST_TAG
          XML element with this name specifies a single host and behaves equivalent to an element with the name = GROUP_TAG value and group size of 1.

          Return the group of hosts with the given ID.
 void parse(org.dom4j.Element elem, Configurator config)
          Parse the XML subtree (with the provided element as a root) and create all the necessary data.
 void setExperimentSize(int size)
          Will be called by the configurator.

getHosts

public java.util.List<Host> getHosts(java.lang.String groupId)
Description copied from interface: HostBuilder
Return the group of hosts with the given ID. This must be the same id as specified in the configuration file. Single hosts with an own id will be returned by this method too (as a list with only one entry).

Specified by:
getHosts in interface HostBuilder
Parameters:
groupId - same group or host id as in the configuration file
Returns:
list of hosts (or single host packed in a list).
